greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest number m < n such that m+n is a prime.
reference: F. W. Roush and D. G. Rogers, A prime algorithm?, preprint, 1999.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
formula: a(n) = p-n where p = largest prime <= 2n-1.
example: Adding 1,2,3,2,5 to 2,3,4,5,6 we get the primes 3,5,7,7,11.
program: a088631 n = a060265 n - n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 22 2015
xref: Cf. A088633. Second column of A088643.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 24 2003
